BULLETIN NO. 152 
GOVERNANCE AND ASSURANCE MANUAL 
08/04/2024 
 
This Bulletin introduces the JIG G&A Manual, available on the JIG Website in the "Standards" area. This 
is a member-only document (including access for Member Locations and JVs in the JIG Inspection 
programme) that is free of charge for the PDF version and is available in print for PS15 (to cover printing 
and shipping costs). Adoption of the manual is voluntary by sites and users. 
Background: 
JIG has developed, over many years, guidance on several Governance and Assurance processes. The 
Governance Processes Committee has undertaken a review of these materials aiming to update them 
and bring them into a single document discussing how these materials link together and more importantly 
how they enable the Governance Committees and site management teams to deliver good Governance 
and Assurance. Ineffective Governance and Assurance has the potential to create risks in aviation fuel 
handling operations; the likelihood increases with the observed trend of reducing knowledge and 
experience. For this reason, the JIG guidance has been thoroughly reviewed. The primary objective of the 
review was to retain the industry knowledge gained in Governance and Assurance and to provide a holistic 
approach for those involved in Governance and Assurance; i.e. JV Representatives, Site Management 
and in-Company

the industry knowledge gained in Governance and Assurance and to provide a holistic 
approach for those involved in Governance and Assurance; i.e. JV Representatives, Site Management 
and in-Company supervisory roles. 
The outcome of this review is the new JIG Governance and Assurance Manual. This Manual is a single a 
single reference document for those involved in the Governance & Assurance roles in joint ventures and 
solus sites handling Aviation fuels. It provides guidance on effective Governance Committees, the tools 
that should be used for effective Governance and Assurance and the process for effective Assurance 
Planning. The manual introduces a checklist aiming to assure shareholders on the health of governance 
and assurance practices at Organizations. It also simplifies access to and understanding of the wide 
range of Governance and Assurance Guidance materials. It brings clarity on the key governance and 
assurance aspects, why they matter and how these should be delivered. 
 
Where to obtain a copy: 
 
The new publication, JIG Business Governance and Assurance Manual, is now available for download at 
this link from the JIG Website in the "Standards & Publications" page. It is available in digital and paper 
versions. The digital version includes hyperlinks to all the supporting base documents hosted in the 
website as detailed below.

Training Packs and Online Courses: 
This new Guidance is supported by five new Training Packs and Facilitator Notes that can be found 
(GP0.01) in the "Policy Documents" tab of the Standards & Publications page. 
The Learning Hub also hosts five online courses (GP1-GP5) that cover the same subject matter. 
SUMMARY 
This Bulletin introduces the JIG Governance & Assurance Manual, which 
includes, in a single publication, all the Good Practice documents and 
tools that JIG has published about the governance and assurance at 
aviation fuel handling facilities.

[Page 2]
Please note that though the Manual also contains references to the JIG BRA process and Tool, this 
guidance has its own Training Pack / User Guide (GP4.06) and an online version of the User Guide, course 
(GP7). 
JIG Recommendations: 
 
JIG has updated its guidance materials, having recognised a need to retain the industry knowledge of the 
principles of governance in an increasingly complex environment. The Manual consequently gives JVs, 
independent operators and companies a framework from which they can use the Good Practice most 
appropriate to them. The guidance is particularly recommended for independent JVs and smaller 
operators who may not have support from a larger organisation. 
More Information: 
JIG will be introducing the Manual at the Manager Workshops in Dublin this week, and for those who are 
not at the workshops, we are holding a webinar on 23rd April to present these guidance materials. Please 
sign up here: 09:00hrs (CET) Webinar.
